CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant claimed a sum of money from a bank .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an application before the ORG challenging the length of these proceedings . On DATE the ORG decided to strike that case ( application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) out of its list of cases on the ground that a friendly settlement had been reached between the parties .
CARDINAL . In the proceedings complained of ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE to dismiss the applicant ’s appeal , examined as an appeal on points of law , became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the above decision was quashed by ORG and the case was remitted to ORG for reexamination .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint challenging the length of the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the first - instance judgment . Upon the applicant ’s appeal on points of law the cassation chamber of ORG quashed that decision on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the first - instance judgment . The applicant indicated that he intended to lodge an appeal on points of law after the service of ORG decision .
